    <span class="s1">partial_size = full_size - </span><span class="s4">1</span>
    <span class="s1">num_full = N - partial_size * num_lists</span>
    <span class="s1">num_partial = num_lists - num_full</span>

    <span class="s1">buffer = []</span>
    <span class="s1">iterator = iter(iterable)</span>

    <span class="s5"># Yield num_full lists of full_size</span>
    <span class="s0">for </span><span class="s1">x </span><span class="s0">in </span><span class="s1">iterator:</span>
        <span class="s1">buffer.append(x)</span>
        <span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">len(buffer) == full_size:</span>
            <span class="s0">yield </span><span class="s1">buffer</span>
            <span class="s1">buffer = []</span>
            <span class="s1">num_full -= </span><span class="s4">1</span>
            <span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">num_full &lt;= </span><span class="s4">0</span><span class="s1">:</span>
                <span class="s0">break</span>

    <span class="s5"># Yield num_partial lists of partial_size</span>
    <span class="s0">for </span><span class="s1">x </span><span class="s0">in </span><span class="s1">iterator:</span>
        <span class="s1">buffer.append(x)</span>
        <span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">len(buffer) == partial_size:</span>
            <span class="s0">yield </span><span class="s1">buffer</span>
            <span class="s1">buffer = []</span>
            <span class="s1">num_partial -= </span><span class="s4">1</span>


<span class="s0">def </span><span class="s1">zip_broadcast(*objects</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">scalar_types=(str</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">bytes)</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">strict=</span><span class="s0">False</span><span class="s1">):</span>
    <span class="s3">&quot;&quot;&quot;A version of :func:`zip` that &quot;broadcasts&quot; any scalar 
    (i.e., non-iterable) items into output tuples. 
 
    &gt;&gt;&gt; iterable_1 = [1, 2, 3] 
    &gt;&gt;&gt; iterable_2 = ['a', 'b', 'c'] 
    &gt;&gt;&gt; scalar = '_' 
    &gt;&gt;&gt; list(zip_broadcast(iterable_1, iterable_2, scalar)) 
    [(1, 'a', '_'), (2, 'b', '_'), (3, 'c', '_')] 
 
    The *scalar_types* keyword argument determines what types are considered 
    scalar. It is set to ``(str, bytes)`` by default. Set it to ``None`` to 
    treat strings and byte strings as iterable: 
 
    &gt;&gt;&gt; list(zip_broadcast('abc', 0, 'xyz', scalar_types=None)) 
    [('a', 0, 'x'), ('b', 0, 'y'), ('c', 0, 'z')] 
 
    If the *strict* keyword argument is ``True``, then 
    ``UnequalIterablesError`` will be raised if any of the iterables have 
    different lengthss. 
    &quot;&quot;&quot;</span>

    <span class="s0">def </span><span class="s1">is_scalar(obj):</span>
        <span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">scalar_types </span><span class="s0">and </span><span class="s1">isinstance(obj</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">scalar_types):</span>
            <span class="s0">return True</span>
        <span class="s0">try</span><span class="s1">:</span>
            <span class="s1">iter(obj)</span>
        <span class="s0">except </span><span class="s1">TypeError:</span>
            <span class="s0">return True</span>
        <span class="s0">else</span><span class="s1">:</span>
            <span class="s0">return False</span>

    <span class="s1">size = len(objects)</span>
    <span class="s0">if not </span><span class="s1">size:</span>
        <span class="s0">return</span>

    <span class="s1">iterables</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">iterable_positions = []</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">[]</span>
    <span class="s1">scalars</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">scalar_positions = []</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">[]</span>
    <span class="s0">for </span><span class="s1">i</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">obj </span><span class="s0">in </span><span class="s1">enumerate(objects):</span>
        <span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">is_scalar(obj):</span>
            <span class="s1">scalars.append(obj)</span>
            <span class="s1">scalar_positions.append(i)</span>
        <span class="s0">else</span><span class="s1">:</span>
            <span class="s1">iterables.append(iter(obj))</span>
            <span class="s1">iterable_positions.append(i)</span>

    <span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">len(scalars) == size:</span>
        <span class="s0">yield </span><span class="s1">tuple(objects)</span>
        <span class="s0">return</span>

    <span class="s1">zipper = _zip_equal </span><span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">strict </span><span class="s0">else </span><span class="s1">zip</span>
    <span class="s0">for </span><span class="s1">item </span><span class="s0">in </span><span class="s1">zipper(*iterables):</span>
        <span class="s1">new_item = [</span><span class="s0">None</span><span class="s1">] * size</span>

        <span class="s0">for </span><span class="s1">i</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">elem </span><span class="s0">in </span><span class="s1">zip(iterable_positions</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">item):</span>
            <span class="s1">new_item[i] = elem</span>

        <span class="s0">for </span><span class="s1">i</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">elem </span><span class="s0">in </span><span class="s1">zip(scalar_positions</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">scalars):</span>
            <span class="s1">new_item[i] = elem</span>

        <span class="s0">yield </span><span class="s1">tuple(new_item)</span>


<span class="s0">def </span><span class="s1">unique_in_window(iterable</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">n</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">key=</span><span class="s0">None</span><span class="s1">):</span>
    <span class="s3">&quot;&quot;&quot;Yield the items from *iterable* that haven't been seen recently. 
    *n* is the size of the lookback window. 
 
        &gt;&gt;&gt; iterable = [0, 1, 0, 2, 3, 0] 
        &gt;&gt;&gt; n = 3 
        &gt;&gt;&gt; list(unique_in_window(iterable, n)) 
        [0, 1, 2, 3, 0] 
 
    The *key* function, if provided, will be used to determine uniqueness: 
 
        &gt;&gt;&gt; list(unique_in_window('abAcda', 3, key=lambda x: x.lower())) 
        ['a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'a'] 
 
    The items in *iterable* must be hashable. 
 
    &quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
    <span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">n &lt;= </span><span class="s4">0</span><span class="s1">:</span>
        <span class="s0">raise </span><span class="s1">ValueError(</span><span class="s2">'n must be greater than 0'</span><span class="s1">)</span>

    <span class="s1">window = deque(maxlen=n)</span>
    <span class="s1">uniques = set()</span>
    <span class="s1">use_key = key </span><span class="s0">is not None</span>

    <span class="s0">for </span><span class="s1">item </span><span class="s0">in </span><span class="s1">iterable:</span>
        <span class="s1">k = key(item) </span><span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">use_key </span><span class="s0">else </span><span class="s1">item</span>
        <span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">k </span><span class="s0">in </span><span class="s1">uniques:</span>
            <span class="s0">continue</span>

        <span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">len(uniques) == n:</span>
            <span class="s1">uniques.discard(window[</span><span class="s4">0</span><span class="s1">])</span>

        <span class="s1">uniques.add(k)</span>
        <span class="s1">window.append(k)</span>

        <span class="s0">yield </span><span class="s1">item</span>


<span class="s0">def </span><span class="s1">duplicates_everseen(iterable</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">key=</span><span class="s0">None</span><span class="s1">):</span>
    <span class="s3">&quot;&quot;&quot;Yield duplicate elements after their first appearance. 
 
    &gt;&gt;&gt; list(duplicates_everseen('mississippi')) 
    ['s', 'i', 's', 's', 'i', 'p', 'i'] 
    &gt;&gt;&gt; list(duplicates_everseen('AaaBbbCccAaa', str.lower)) 
    ['a', 'a', 'b', 'b', 'c', 'c', 'A', 'a', 'a'] 
 
    This function is analagous to :func:`unique_everseen` and is subject to 
    the same performance considerations. 
 
    &quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
    <span class="s1">seen_set = set()</span>
    <span class="s1">seen_list = []</span>
    <span class="s1">use_key = key </span><span class="s0">is not None</span>

    <span class="s0">for </span><span class="s1">element </span><span class="s0">in </span><span class="s1">iterable:</span>
        <span class="s1">k = key(element) </span><span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">use_key </span><span class="s0">else </span><span class="s1">element</span>
        <span class="s0">try</span><span class="s1">:</span>
            <span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">k </span><span class="s0">not in </span><span class="s1">seen_set:</span>
                <span class="s1">seen_set.add(k)</span>
            <span class="s0">else</span><span class="s1">:</span>
                <span class="s0">yield </span><span class="s1">element</span>
        <span class="s0">except </span><span class="s1">TypeError:</span>
            <span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">k </span><span class="s0">not in </span><span class="s1">seen_list:</span>
                <span class="s1">seen_list.append(k)</span>
            <span class="s0">else</span><span class="s1">:</span>
                <span class="s0">yield </span><span class="s1">element</span>


<span class="s0">def </span><span class="s1">duplicates_justseen(iterable</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">key=</span><span class="s0">None</span><span class="s1">):</span>
    <span class="s3">&quot;&quot;&quot;Yields serially-duplicate elements after their first appearance. 
 
    &gt;&gt;&gt; list(duplicates_justseen('mississippi')) 
    ['s', 's', 'p'] 
    &gt;&gt;&gt; list(duplicates_justseen('AaaBbbCccAaa', str.lower)) 
    ['a', 'a', 'b', 'b', 'c', 'c', 'a', 'a'] 
 
    This function is analagous to :func:`unique_justseen`. 
 
    &quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
    <span class="s0">return </span><span class="s1">flatten(</span>
        <span class="s1">map(</span>
            <span class="s0">lambda </span><span class="s1">group_tuple: islice_extended(group_tuple[</span><span class="s4">1</span><span class="s1">])[</span><span class="s4">1</span><span class="s1">:]</span><span class="s0">,</span>
            <span class="s1">groupby(iterable</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">key)</span><span class="s0">,</span>
        <span class="s1">)</span>
    <span class="s1">)</span>


<span class="s0">def </span><span class="s1">minmax(iterable_or_value</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">*others</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">key=</span><span class="s0">None, </span><span class="s1">default=_marker):</span>
    <span class="s3">&quot;&quot;&quot;Returns both the smallest and largest items in an iterable 
    or the largest of two or more arguments. 
 
        &gt;&gt;&gt; minmax([3, 1, 5]) 
        (1, 5) 
 
        &gt;&gt;&gt; minmax(4, 2, 6) 
        (2, 6) 
 
    If a *key* function is provided, it will be used to transform the input 
    items for comparison. 
 
        &gt;&gt;&gt; minmax([5, 30], key=str)  # '30' sorts before '5' 
        (30, 5) 
 
    If a *default* value is provided, it will be returned if there are no 
    input items. 
 
        &gt;&gt;&gt; minmax([], default=(0, 0)) 
        (0, 0) 
 
    Otherwise ``ValueError`` is raised. 
 
    This function is based on the 
    `recipe &lt;http://code.activestate.com/recipes/577916/&gt;`__ by 
    Raymond Hettinger and takes care to minimize the number of comparisons 
    performed. 
    &quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
    <span class="s1">iterable = (iterable_or_value</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">*others) </span><span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">others </span><span class="s0">else </span><span class="s1">iterable_or_value</span>

    <span class="s1">it = iter(iterable)</span>

    <span class="s0">try</span><span class="s1">:</span>
        <span class="s1">lo = hi = next(it)</span>
    <span class="s0">except </span><span class="s1">StopIteration </span><span class="s0">as </span><span class="s1">e:</span>
        <span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">default </span><span class="s0">is </span><span class="s1">_marker:</span>
            <span class="s0">raise </span><span class="s1">ValueError(</span>
                <span class="s2">'`minmax()` argument is an empty iterable. '</span>
                <span class="s2">'Provide a `default` value to suppress this error.'</span>
            <span class="s1">) </span><span class="s0">from </span><span class="s1">e</span>
        <span class="s0">return </span><span class="s1">default</span>

    <span class="s5"># Different branches depending on the presence of key. This saves a lot</span>
    <span class="s5"># of unimportant copies which would slow the &quot;key=None&quot; branch</span>
    <span class="s5"># significantly down.</span>
    <span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">key </span><span class="s0">is None</span><span class="s1">:</span>
        <span class="s0">for </span><span class="s1">x</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">y </span><span class="s0">in </span><span class="s1">zip_longest(it</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">it</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">fillvalue=lo):</span>
            <span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">y &lt; x:</span>
                <span class="s1">x</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">y = y</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">x</span>
            <span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">x &lt; lo:</span>
                <span class="s1">lo = x</span>
            <span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">hi &lt; y:</span>
                <span class="s1">hi = y</span>

    <span class="s0">else</span><span class="s1">:</span>
        <span class="s1">lo_key = hi_key = key(lo)</span>

        <span class="s0">for </span><span class="s1">x</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">y </span><span class="s0">in </span><span class="s1">zip_longest(it</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">it</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">fillvalue=lo):</span>

            <span class="s1">x_key</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">y_key = key(x)</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">key(y)</span>

            <span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">y_key &lt; x_key:</span>
                <span class="s1">x</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">y</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">x_key</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">y_key = y</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">x</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">y_key</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">x_key</span>
            <span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">x_key &lt; lo_key:</span>
                <span class="s1">lo</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">lo_key = x</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">x_key</span>
            <span class="s0">if </span><span class="s1">hi_key &lt; y_key:</span>
                <span class="s1">hi</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">hi_key = y</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">y_key</span>

    <span class="s0">return </span><span class="s1">lo</span><span class="s0">, </span><span class="s1">hi</span>
</pre>
